hook.text: In 1965, two engineers found a mysterious signal in their antenna. It came from everywhere.

buildup.text: Arno Penzias and Robert Wilson at Bell Labs couldn't eliminate the static noise.

twist.text: They thought it was pigeon droppings on the antenna at first. They cleaned it. The signal remained.

climax.text: The CMB is the oldest light in the universe â€” from 380,000 years after the Big Bang.

punchline.text: The strongest evidence for the Big Bang was mistaken for bird poop. Science is messy.
